pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:5.1: 36. The training rule on covering with rice
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six covered the various kinds of curry with rice because they wanted more. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:7.1: “‘I will not cover the various kinds of curry with rice because I want more,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:8.1: The various kinds of curry should not be covered with rice because one wants more.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect covers the various kinds of curry with rice because he wants more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:10.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
